title: On The Trail With Elizabeth Warren
description: In an ongoing series, The NPR Politics Podcast is hitting the road and interviewing 2020 Democratic presidential candidates. In this episode, Asma Khalid and Iowa Public Radio's Clay Masters sit down with Massachusetts Sen. Elizabeth Warren to ask about why she's the best pick for president. This series is produced in collaboration with NHPR and Iowa Public Radio.
copyright: Copyright 2015-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: On The Trail With Elizabeth Warren
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: In an interview with The NPR Politics Podcast, the Democratic presidential candidate spoke about structural change on trade and guns, and how her life shapes her politics.
itunes:subtitle: In an interview with The NPR Politics Podcast, the Democratic presidential candidate spoke about structural change on trade and guns, and how her life shapes her politics.
